prompt:
I have the following gene expression data, "leukemiaExp.txt". The file is tab separated. The table has gene names on the first column. Each row is a gene and each column is a distinct sample.  If there are more samples than 500 then randomly sample the samples column and create a subset of the data. Create a boxplot of the columns

response:
```
# Load the gene expression data
gene_data <- read.table("leukemiaExp.txt", sep="\t", header=TRUE)

# Check the number of columns
num_columns <- ncol(gene_data)

# Check if there are more than 500 columns
if (num_columns > 500) {
  # Set seed for reproducibility
  set.seed(123)
  
  # Randomly sample 500 columns
  sampled_columns <- sample(1:num_columns, size=500, replace=FALSE)
  
  # Subset the data with the sampled columns
  subset_data <- gene_data[, sampled_columns]
  
  # Create a boxplot of the subset data
  boxplot(subset_data, col="lightblue", main="Gene Expression Boxplot", xlab="Samples", ylab="Expression Level")
} else {
  # Create a boxplot of the original data
  boxplot(gene_data, col="lightblue", main="Gene Expression Boxplot", xlab="Samples", ylab="Expression Level")
}
```
